headline: President Trump seeks climate deal that's fair to US
subHeadline: Announces U.S. will withdraw from the Paris Climate Agreement; reaction and analysis on 'The Five'

utterances.sentences: Hello, everyone. I'm Dana Perino, along with Kimberly Guilfoyle, Juan Williams, Jesse Watters and Greg Gutfeld. It's 9 o'clock in New York City, and this is "The Five." President Trump today fulfilled a controversial and major campaign promise by pulling the United States out of the landmark Paris climate agreement. The climate pack seeks to reduce the amount of worldwide pollution emissions. utterances.sentences: -- anti-Americans, excuses, low information voters, remember them?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. Kimberly, if you were ever to play a drinking game and take a shot every time Hillary made an excuse for losing, you'd be hammered in about 10 minutes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes, I don't think I'm playing that game. That's a very dangerous game for me to play. But speaking of like bitter clingers, who's the bitter clingers now?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Right? Still just holding on, can't let it go. We lost. Want to blame everybody and its like pin the tail on the clinger. Which one of them are they say is the one that sticks that they can finally rest assured that they can blame the entire election on, right? This is what's happening. She can't handle it. She's super upset but I think she's blowing it with her supporters.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You know who else interfered in the election? The Chinese in the 1996 Clinton re-election campaign when they funneled all that shady dough into the DNC and Hillary's coffers. She must know something about that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, remember, she's on this tour partly because she is selling her book, pre-sales, as she got millions of dollars for a book that's coming out this fall so she is at this -- they eventually is out today. It's called -- basically before the expo (ph). So she comes in and she previews it for all of the booksellers so that they'll buy a lot of books so she can hopefully sell a lot of books. One of my favorite quotes from a presidential autobiography was, in decision point, when President Bush wrote, "self-pity is a pathetic quality in a leader." And I had a former senior advisor of hers e-mailed me last night and he said, "it simply the most embarrassing I've ever seen her, filled with unsubstantiated conspiracy theories that really were borderline crazy. It's a complete denial of our democracy. I don't know the point. Sanders people don't trust her. Trump supporters hate her. So she keeps sinking below Trump and she isn't reaching out to people and still they think that she actually believe that she might be able to run again."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Wait, who e-mailed that to you, Bill Clinton?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: President Clinton

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That's what I was thinking.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Believe me, I'm not getting a call from anybody at 8:00 a.m.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well Juan, Hillary also blamed the DNC, Democratic National Committee, for losing. Now, didn't the DNC rigged the primary against Bernie? Wasn't that enough --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I don't know about rigged but I think - -

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's what the e-mails show.

utterances.speaker: WILLIANS
utterances.sentences: You know, no, what the e-mail show was that they thought that she was the better candidate. That they had an interest in Hillary --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, no, there was --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- that's why they all protested at the DNC in Philly about it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, they thought --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- they had the --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: The DNC Wasserman Schultz and that whole gang thought she was the better candidate. You know what strikes me in this conversation is, so much of what she says is true.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh my god.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: And I was like, amazing. People say oh, it's whiny. It's whiny - -

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK, so you agree with that entire list we saw?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, but I'm saying how can you say it's whiny that the Russians influenced the election? That's the truth. How can you say it's whiny when, you know, Gallup did a poll and said --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: -- contents, forms and Macedonia.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: -- when you put in Hillary Clinton's name, and this I got from Jessica Tarlov who wrote this piece for foxnews.com. It says the words e- mail lie and her came up, not president, not capable, not best for (INAUDIBLE) to do the job. This is the influence that people -- and you say, oh, this is too whiny.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Facebook and Google now rigged it against Hillary. Greg, would you like to respond?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Do you remember that story about that mayor, I think it was in Tennessee, that ran for office and won and he was dead at the time? He was a better candidate than her.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Ouch.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That you could say --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: He blamed him for --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That they could say that some of these things are true but nothing will be more true than the fact that she was an awful candidate.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Correct. It's horrible.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Now Trump may call you names and he may not like you but no one will ever think less of you than Hillary Clinton. Her whole life is about getting away from the ravel whereas Trump decided to embrace every man and every woman. Think about like, you know, people are criticizing Donald Trump over the Paris accords. Hillary pollutes the air because she wanted to a separate plane. She didn't want to fly with Michelle Obama to Betty Ford's funeral so she preferred to use her own plane. That's worse than anything Trump has done. Maybe she could have been a good president. The fact is, she's the queen of victimhood and her performance shows you that she would still cling, bitterly cling to identity driven politics. And it would affect all of her decision-making, nothing will change. She has embraced a dying ideology. She's kind of pathetic and sad.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Well, she blamed everybody. People --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: -- misogynist, suburban women -- Democrats making bad documentaries.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, Michael Moore didn't do enough. OK, when we come back, Greg, has some advice for one of President Trump's fiercest critics. Stay tuned.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Thank you baby. Hooray, George Will wrote a new column! It's called "Conservatism is soiled by scowling primitives." He writes, "Today, conservativoism is soiled by scowling primitives whose irritable gestures lack mental ingredients. America needs a reminder of conservatism before vulgarians hijacked it." Fair enough, but should one engage hijacked conservatives by calling the people that they might support "scowling primitives"? Something tells me isn't about George giving advice, but flexing his intellectual muscles. Anyway, I'm seeing a lot of this. Conservatives go after Trump and his supporters often using a tone of knowing mockery. It's not that you're wrong but you're also stupid. You know who else does this? Trump apostles. Yesterday Corey Lewandowski said this:

utterances.speaker: CORESY LEWANDOWSKY, FORMER TRUMP CAMPAIGN MANAGER
utterances.sentences: It's very simple, you know, President Trump was elected to change the country and you can get on board that train or you can lose your next election.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Get on that train, and who could forget this doozy?

utterances.speaker: OMAROSA MANIGAULT, TRUMP POLITICAL AIDE
utterances.sentences: Every critic, every dertractor will have to bow down to President Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Anyway, so here you have two sides within the same party battling over who's going to be right when this is all over. But we know the truth as always is in between. A Never Trumper is right on many of Trump's flaws. A Trump apostle is right that the president needs support. A Never Trumper is wrong to think Trump isn't trying to do right by Americans. A Trump apostle is wrong to deny serious obvious mistakes. Fact is, sticking to one perception creates a forced purity of thought that blinds you to realities which then keeps you from offering constructive criticism that might help a leader who actually could use it. So never say never and stop saying always. History shows that lockstep is always a march to disaster. At least I can say that today, the Never Trumpers and pro Trumpers united under the -- over the lefty meltdown.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, Matt Dawson (ph) tweeted that. It showed the picture of, you know, during World War I where like, let's just stop for Christmas and everyone like laughed. No one likes a scold, right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And the scolding is getting out of hand but they're also missing the real point, which is I think also what you're saying, that it's not a matter of intellectual style ora matter of basically just getting on the train. The hard work is actually about a strategy and then trying to get it done. So, there's a lot that they want to do together, health care reform, tax reform, infrastructure plans, et cetera, that it just takes a lot of granular work. So grand gestures like the filibuster to shut down government because of Obamacare to try to repeal it, like those things don't actually work.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: The good news for President Trump is that the majority of Republican (INAUDIBLE) is like 89 percent are with him on the policies. So now, like, the time to put the shoulder behind the --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Whatever the thing --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That thing on the football field.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't know what it is. Hey Juan.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Sports analogy --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: My sports analogies are so bad. You haven't been --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Well, you pick winning teams.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Juan, I want to ask you because I enjoyed George Will's writing. Sometimes it's hard to understand.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You got to read it twice.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I think he likes the thesaurus a lot.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But anyway --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I like it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: -- I feel like I enjoy his writing but I don't think he's actually trying to convince anyone anymore. I think right now he is just kind of like firing the arrows and enjoying the strange new respect from liberals when he does it. Is that fair to say?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: He's on with him a lot.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You said what?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You have been on air with him a lot.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, I like George, but I think this is interesting because, you know, usually, when you're dealing with conservatives, the argument would be that it's the left that's elitist. But now in this moment, here is George Will, who is I think an inheritor to William F. Buckley and that legacy of conservatism in America saying in fact, that he thinks that that legacy is being hurt.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I disagree. He's definitely no William F. Buckley.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I said an inheritor.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, but Buckley would get in and sit and argue and fight.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He'd get down and dirty. George Will is above that. He doesn't even wear jeans.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I think George will fight -- I know he will fight with me. I don't know about you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I think he fought with O'Reilly once.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: One time and done.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But I will say this, that if you look at the numbers right now, you see that President Trump's numbers are going down with Republicans. I think he's down to about 80 percent. But it's even farther down with conservatives who say, you know, I'm not sure about Trump and young people. I think now about a quarter of young people who were identified as Republicans leave. Something's going on there, but it could be that people are uncomfortable.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: But then why did the other polls show that people who supported President Trump in the election, 96 percent, said they would vote for him again.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well no, 80 percent, and in fact Bloomberg, the former mayor of New York said, I think yesterday, he thinks there's a 55 percent chance that Trump would get reelected.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I think he's right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Eight years of Trump, Juan, what are you going to do?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I don't know. I said before that, you know, Jesus take the wheel.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Listen, George Will has never been on board with the whole situation. He was a very strong and vocal critic of President Trump, candidate Trump, you know, from day one. So, I don't find this to be that surprising.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And there were consequences for him for taking that (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYL
utterances.sentences: There were.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And I think there's room in the Republican Party for the George Wills, for the nationalists, for the Bushes where we've had Eisenhower as a general. We've had an actor who is president. We've had now a mogul president so I mean, things evolve. The country wants different things. I don't think it helps when you have someone in the party saying the people that put your president in office are vulgarians or barbarians.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I think it's OK if a party moves the president to the left or moves him to right, but this doesn't help at all. I think, you know, securing the border is civilized. I think protecting American jobs from going overseas is civilized and compassionate. I don't see anything vulgar about that at all. I'd like everybody to be able to come together for the next two years to pass in legislation and make sure people have money. So I think that's what they need to do and I think there's room for cooperation.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right, well on that upbeat note, new development in the Russia investigation. This time it might be bad news for Obama's top advisors. Details, when we return.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: The House Intel Committee yesterday issued more subpoenas in the Russia investigation. The committee specifically looking into unmasking requests from three former Obama administration officials, Susan Rice, John Brennan and Samantha Power. President Trump tweeted today, "The big story is the unmasking and surveillance of people that took place during the Obama administration." Now, there were also subpoenas issued that had to do with the Russia investigation but the surprise is these four and coming from, Kimberly, Devon Nunez, who I thought had taken a step back but it looks like Devin Nunez is still a player.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I think this is a huge story. I'm not sure why it hasn't gotten more coverage to be honest because it's something I think that's very significant. That should be something it grabs the attention of all Americans in terms of a privacy grab and surveillance which is, you know, one of the basic things that we hold near to our hearts and dear in this country. We fought for our liberty, our freedoms, our privacy rights. And here we've seen, you know, evidence, suggestion that this actually has occurred. So, I think it's important that they conduct the investigation and really get to the bottom of this and it can't just be swept away with just an inordinate amount of focus on Russia collusion with so far we have no evidence of.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So, what do you think? You have Jim Comey now saying his testimony is going to come next Thursday, but you have this ongoing effort and it looks like this is what President Trump believes is as he says the big story, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, I think Democrats are going to regret these investigations because it might boomerang on them and, you know, I think the Russian thing is going to hurt them. Look, if Susan Rice, Brennan, and now Samantha Power, I mean, she's not even at all affiliated with the intelligence community so what was she doing submitting unmasking requests? So remember, there's paperwork for each unmasking request. They're going to, under oath, asked them why'd you do it. If they take the fifth, if they perjure themselves or they give some sort of partisan reason or unmasking these Trump people and then were disseminating classified information, we have a full-blown political spying scandal on our hands and that's a big deal.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Don't be surprised if they --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I think it would be a political scandal if they were using it for political purposes, but Dana, the contrary point of view is oh, then they find out why? They made these unmasking requests and it could be that then that implicates some of Trump's associates.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right. So the hard thing about talking about this every night is that there is a fact-finding mission underway and we don't really have any of them so, I would like to just let that fact finding mission continue for them to answer questions on all (INAUDIBLE) procedures for unmasking, where they properly followed? What were the reasons why and let's just get answers to all of it. And I do wonder -- I do think the Nunes thing is bizarre because if you say you're going to take a step back and then you're issuing subpoenas without talking to your partisan counterpart, in this case the Democrats, I do think that that is a little strange.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: What do you think? Is this more explosive than the Russia stuff, Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't know, subpoena is such a funny word.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I can't spell it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I can't spell it and when I say it I always feel dirty.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Really.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's what I thought about it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: That's your state of mind.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. By the way, this story seems so last month. It's like, you know, I hear the name Devin Nunes and I go like, who is that? That was only like two months ago, but in this --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Maybe that's why he issued the subpoenas.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Really?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Now you'll remember.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What subpoenas?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They remember my name.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What subpoenas?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh my gosh. Let's get out of here, now! "One More Thing" is up next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Time now for "One More Thing." Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Let's just go right now. I hate these people! All right, you know what this is? Show them. Just show it. It is antidiarrheal medication.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my god, what is wrong with you?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: OK, no, this is important. Show it. I want you to show it again. This is antidiarrheal medication. This is not the kind of packaging you put a pill that somebody with diarrhea needs.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Do you know how long it takes someone in a panic to open up that, especially with stubby fingers? I know every American has been through this. You know what I'm talking about. You cannot open this thing and it scares the hell out of you. Change the packaging right now or I am protesting and I don't even know how to protest.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Jesse, ever have that problem?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: When did this happen? I thought you had a sinus issue.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Wow, I don't know how to follow that up.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But you are next.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: But I will, OK. So, a scandal bigger than Russia is hitting Citi Field in New York. Fingergate.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh my god.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: This is Mr. Met.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: This is getting worse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Flipping the bird to a fan.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The guy seems just asking for a high five. Mr. Met gave him the middle finger. He's now been re-assigned. That guy will no longer be performing the Mr. Met duties. We have another Mr. Met who's not going to be put in --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Is he going to be a guest on "Watters World"?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right Juan, you're next.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right, the Philly fanatic would have got a promotion. Fifty years ago today, beautiful magic happened.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: On this day on '67, The Beatles record "Sergeant Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band" was released in the U.S.A. It remains a landmark for people of a certain age, a touchstone of our youth. I was a 13 when this came out and my favorite track was "When I'm 64." One of the lines says, "will you still be singing me a Valentine, birthday greetings when I'm 64."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There were no bashing --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I'm just hoping Greg will be screaming at me next year, when I am 64.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I'm heavily sponsored. All right, everybody, it's Kimberly's food court is amazing tonight. Greg, you're blocking my shot.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm taking this.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: OK, (INAUDIBLE) McMillis (ph) went out fishing last month at a Texas lake and he wasn't having any luck. He didn't catch anything. So then his girlfriend came up with this idea. Using McDonalds chicken McNugget as bait, and then he's got a 24 inch -- you've ruined my (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No way.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE) weighing nearly 11 pounds, and it's a record at the lake.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: There it is.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: But I have this in real life.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: These are really good.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Jesse loves them too.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: When you're sticking negatives around here, my "One More Thing" will remain a mystery. Set your DVR and never miss an episode of "The Five." "Hannity" is up next.
